utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I was wondering if you could tell me what brought you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, I've been coughing for the past three days and it I can't seem to stop. It's affecting my sleep, so I just really like to get this fixed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, ah is the cough, with the cough have you been bringing up any sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's it's dry. It's very dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you brought up any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and the cough started three days ago. Has it gotten worse, gotten better, stayed the same?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah you know, it seems to be getting worse, and now I even feel hot like I have a fever or something.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see. Is there any triggers associated with the cough like going outside into the cold, smoke inhalation or or dust or pets?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, not that I noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you tried anything to you help with the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I tried over the counter cough syrup, but it's it's not helping.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you mentioned the coughs interrupting your sleep. Has is the cough constant all day or are there particular times of the day that it's worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's just all day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Let's see OK, Um, and you mentioned that you started to feel hot when when did you notice that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That was just today.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Just today, have you taken your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been experiencing any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mmm. I've been really tired but I don't know if that's because I can't get any seem to get any sleep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Well, because the coughs been keeping you up OK. Um, so have you had any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe a slight headache, but also I'm not too sure if that's because I've been coughing and it's putting strain on my head.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about any discharge like mucus or tears from your eyes or ears?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about any pain around your eyes or ears?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had a runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mmmm, no no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And within the last month or so, have you had any cold like symptoms with a runny nose, headache, sore throat, and or a cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's just been these last few days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, alright, and do you have a sore throat now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and, and how is your appetite been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My appetite's been OK. I also it's just hard to eat because I'm coughing so much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any troubles with swallowing, like being painful?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, well, no no. I would say no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um an in the last several months. Have you had any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no weight loss.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you had any chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe a little bit last night now that I think about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: A little bit last night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you were a bit chilly and and then sweaty late last night?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, a little bit.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and feeling hot today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, no chest pain no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and how about shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you had any instances where you felt as though your heart was racing or beating out of your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and any instances where you felt like you were gonna faint, or maybe blackout?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and, have you felt dizzy at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, no dizziness.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and have you had any loss or of your sense of taste or loss of your sense of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and then how about any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um. And so you have been fatigued? Have you had any muscle aches or or body aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: A little bit of both, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK and have you had any painful urination or feeling the need to urinate frequently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any skin rashes or or skin changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um in regards to your past health. Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have hypothyroidism.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK and um, are you taking any medications for that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm on Synthroid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, great, when was your last TSH checked?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I believe I did it six months ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and were there any concerns with the range at that time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I think it was normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright excellent, do you take any other medications or over the counter?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I take this multi vitamin. I can't remember the name of it, but it's just something that I take every day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and have you had any surgeries before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I had my appendix removed when I was a teenager.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any complications with that surgery?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um so next I was wondering if you could just tell me a little bit about your living situation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, I live with my husband and two children who are both teenagers. I, we live in a in a townhouse, and we moved recently.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and anybody in the home been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My husband has been throwing up for the past two days and I think he was feeling a little hot too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, has he been assessed by a physician?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I tried to bring him today, but he refused.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK. Has he been around anybody who's been sick that you're aware of, like at work or anything?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He works at this IT company. There aren't a lot of them and they all have their own cubicles, so you know, maybe in the lunch room or something, but other than that, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about yourself? Any other exposures or sick contacts or maybe at work or something like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um so I do marketing stuff online, but I I work from home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and your kids have been well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, they've been. They've been healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'll have a glass of wine with dinner once in awhile.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you and what's once in awhile?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe every three or four days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so a couple of drinks per week?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and do you smoke marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have smoked marijuana. I don't regularly do it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, um and do you use any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um and has anybody in the family had a lung condition or or a heart condition before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My sister, who's 15 years older than I am, she had a heart attack quite recently.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. Do you know what happened?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, you know, I'm not too sure she doesn't always eat the healthiest, and she doesn't do a lot of exercise. So I think maybe that had something to do with it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and did your parents have any heart problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, they were both healthy and they passed away a few years ago, but they died of old age, I guess you can say.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright so I think that's all I wanted to cover on the history today. Was there anything that you wanted to tell me I maybe didn't ask?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, I was just curious if you think I had COVID?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Certainly one of the top things that I'm considering after hearing about your symptoms of having this cough and fever and being tired these last few days, especially with your husband being sick with nausea, vomiting, and not feeling well. That being said, it could be another type of viral illness, or possibly a bacterial infection. But certainly we will order some investigations, some blood work, a PCR nasal swab that will actually test for COVID as well as a chest X Ray to start with. Um and we will wait for some of those results to come back.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, yeah, that sounds good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so we'll get that started.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
